com.topcoder.util.datavalidator
Class PrimitiveValidator

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.datavalidator.AbstractObjectValidator
      com.topcoder.util.datavalidator.PrimitiveValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectValidator, java.io.Serializable
public class PrimitiveValidator
extends AbstractObjectValidator

This is a specific wrapper for all validators that deal with primitive type value validation such a Integer, Boolean, Long, Double, Float, Byte, or Short this is nothing more than a convenience wrapper.

Thread Safety:This is thread-safe since it is immutable.

Version:
1.1
Author:
WishingBone, zimmy, AleaActaEst, telly12
See Also:
Serialized Form

getMessages

public java.lang.String[] getMessages(java.lang.Object object)

Gives error information about the given object being validated. This method will return possibly a number of messages produced for this object by a number of validators if the validator is composite.

Specified by:
getMessages in interface ObjectValidator
Overrides:
getMessages in class AbstractObjectValidator
Parameters:
object - the object to validate
Returns:
String[] a non-empty but possibly null array of failure messages
Since:
1.1

getAllMessages

public java.lang.String[] getAllMessages(java.lang.Object object)

This is the same method concept as the getMessage() except that this method will evaluate the whole validator tree and return all the messages from any validators that failed the object.

Specified by:
getAllMessages in interface ObjectValidator
Overrides:
getAllMessages in class AbstractObjectValidator
Parameters:
object - the object to validate
Returns:
String[] a non-empty but possibly null array of failure messages
Since:
1.1

getAllMessages

public java.lang.String[] getAllMessages(java.lang.Object object,
                                         int messageLimit)

This is another version of the getAllMessages() method which accepts a limit on how many messages at most will be requested. This means that the traversal of the validator tree will stop the moment messageLimit has been met. This is provided so that the user can limit the number of messages coming back and thus limit the traversal time but still get a reasonable number of messages back to the user.

Specified by:
getAllMessages in interface ObjectValidator
Overrides:
getAllMessages in class AbstractObjectValidator
Parameters:
object - the object to validate
messageLimit - the max number of messages. This must be greater-than-or-equal to 0.
Returns:
String[] a non-empty but possibly null array of failure messages with a most messageLimit messages.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if messageLimit is not positive
Since:
1.1
